Package cu.edu.cujae.graphy.core.defaults

Class DefaultSimpleGraph<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • cu.edu.cujae.graphy.core.abstractions.AbstractGraph<T>
      • cu.edu.cujae.graphy.core.abstractions.AdjacencyListGraph<T>
        • cu.edu.cujae.graphy.core.defaults.DefaultSimpleGraph<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Graph<T>, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<T>
    public class DefaultSimpleGraph<T>
extends AdjacencyListGraph<T>
implements Graph<T>, java.lang.Cloneable
    This is a default implementation of the Graph interface.It is a simple graph (not simple in the mathematical sense of a "simple graph", but in the sense of the most basic implementation you will find in this library). It does not aim to be the ultimate representation of a graph, but rather a default implementation that uncaring users may rely upon.

    For more complex or more specific needs, the entire library is customizable via design patterns and the use of this library's API.

    Author:
    Javier Marrero

    • Method Detail

      • duplicate

        public Graph<T> duplicate()
                   throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
        This method should be, at some extent, similar to the Java cloning mechanism in that returns a deep copy of this object.The returned graph is not a view of this graph but two independent objects. Changes are not guaranteed to persists across clone instances as they don't share data.

        While the two graphs does not share any internal representation, they both point to the same data, so any data manipulation will be seen in the original graph. If deep cloning of the internal data is desired, perform a manual copy or rather use the utility methods provided by the class Graphs.

        If by any means the duplication cannot be made, a CloneNotSupportedException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        duplicate in interface Graph<T>
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException

      • isWeighted

        Returns if the graph is weighted or not.
